entry.content:
This reverts commit 5b3683a741fe6c19fc23bdbc0c708633e5b68fcd.



Reason for revert: suspected to be test failure:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/b8775646255288635329/overview

> graphite: Remove bottom left origin CanvasResourceProvider usage

>

> Graphite won't support bottom left origin SkSurfaces or rendering. This

entry.title: Remove Apps.Lockscreen.* histogram recording and mark obsolete.
entry.content:
Lock screen apps are essentially not currently supported, as they were

only supported originally for Chrome Apps (Chrome Apps are now

deprecated) and support for Web Apps was never launched. Usage is

extremely low as no current apps support the feature.



Not yet sure if the feature should be deleted entirely (and that will be

a big CL) so just delete the metrics, that have all expired or are close

to expiry.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Apps.Lockscreen.* removed as lock screen apps are not currently supported.



Bug: 1200355

Fixed: 1200355

Change-Id: Ie13912ca96e3d1c0ebe33834b187e62edfed6993

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4680765

Commit-Queue: Glen Robertson

Reviewed-by: Tim Sergeant

Reviewed-by: Giovanni Ortuno Urquidi

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1170346}

entry.title: /third_party/libaom: Ensure all paths are relative
entry.content:
Absolute paths make sandboxing, remote execution and caching

impossible, because they cannot be reproduced on other systems

and also vary by user and location of the current Chromium

checkout. It's best to use relative paths only.



With these fixes, the generated Ninja files no longer contain any

absolute paths that refer to my home directory, at least on Linux.



I verified that the build still works by building `all` target.



CQ run also passed for the pre-split CL: crrev.com/c/4682679



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=jzern@google.com



Bug: b/291175318

Change-Id: Iad7f7aa7c0b863e854734c9ab27a51fe7a882635

entry.title: Reland "Reland "Close the blank tab opened by clicking target=_blank links to home tab""
entry.content:
This reverts commit ad2f6dce3504fee5d64647b3e0f3d727305c0608.



Reason for revert: Disable the test on Mac as well. Like the previous

Windows failure, it was failing on a single Mac builder and can't be

repro'd locally or on CQ.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Reland "Close the blank tab opened by clicking target=_blank links to home tab""

>

> This reverts commit 1d43aebe6f6a83c6d9181c0ad1780a737292a0ab.

>

> Reason for revert: Suspicious about test failures of WebAppTabStripBrowserTest.NavigationThrottle

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac12%20Tests/10565/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > Reland "Close the blank tab opened by clicking target=_blank links to home tab"

> >

> > This reverts commit 33c4f6d486508b80d817dc83fe4d09c081b4a7c6.

> >

> > Reason for revert: Disable failing test on Windows. The test was

> > failing on a single Windows builder and I can't reproduce locally or

> > on CQ. I'll try to enable the test in a more targetted follow up.

> >

> > Original change's description:

> > > Revert "Close the blank tab opened by clicking target=_blank links to home tab"

> > >

> > > This reverts commit 5f544b6e1fa028698d7cce8a94cf99858d445039.

> > >

> > > Reason for revert: Suspicious about test failures of WebAppTabStripBrowserTest.NavigationThrottle

> > > https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/Win10%20Tests%20x64/80872

> > >

> > > Original change's description:

> > > > Close the blank tab opened by clicking target=_blank links to home tab

> > > >

> > > > In tabbed apps with a pinned home tab, clicking a target=_blank link

> > > > to the home tab causes a blank tab to be opened in the app. This

> > > > happens because a new tab is opened because of the target=_blank but

> > > > then the URL is opened in the home tab, leaving the new tab there.

> > > >

> > > > This change closes the blank tab that was opened.

> > > >

> > > > Bug: 1417525

> > > > Change-Id: Ie8fdcb3a22af0b776e8e2e17a300feefaf49421a

entry.title: PA: Remove dependency on third_party/lss
entry.content:
This CL is continued from crrev.com/c/3819652.



This CL cuts the dependency on LSS for Linux and CrOS.

At time of writing, no supported CrOS device ships with kernel < 4.4,

so we can safely assume that `getrandom` does exist as a syscall.

entry.title: NoCopyBack: Remove NGBlockNode::StoreMargins()
entry.content:
This is a preparation to store margins in physical fragments.



* Remove NGBlockNode::StoreMargins()

* Add a "margins" argument to NGBoxFragmentBuilder::AddResult(), and

add AddResult() overloads to avoid code size increase.

AddResult() implementation calls LayoutBox::SetMargin().



This CL has no behavior changes.

entry.title: Support registering dictionaries using no-cors mode same origin request
entry.content:
Currently we allow registering dictionaries only if the request was

fetched using `cors` enabled mode or `same-origin` mode. This CL changes

it to support registering dictionaries using `no-cors` mode requests

only when the response tainting mode is `basic`. The basic response

tainting mode of `no-cors` request means that the response was served

from the same origin server without cross origin redirect.



This CL also add CHECK() to ensure that `opaque` response tainting

requests should not trigger dictionary registration.



Bug: 1413922

entry.title: Support using shared dictionaries for no-cors mode same origin request
entry.content:
This CL changes the logic of the LOAD_CAN_USE_SHARED_DICTIONARY flag to

allow using shared dictionaries for no-cors mode same origin requests.



The response of no-cors mode same origin request is not opaque. The

response type is `basic`, and the response body is readable.



After crrev.com/c/4676853 , no-cors requests are not supported for using

shared dictionaries. This was problematic because we want to allow using

shared dictionaries for no-cors mode same origin requests, such as same

origin script loading.



The new logic of the LOAD_CAN_USE_SHARED_DICTIONARY flag allows using

shared dictionaries for no-cors mode same origin requests.

network::CorsURLLoader sets this flag if the request mode is not

no-cors. Also if the request mode is no-cors and the request is a same

origin request, network::CorsURLLoader sets this flag and a new

DISABLE_SHARED_DICTIONARY_AFTER_CROSS_ORIGIN_REDIRECT flag.



When net::URLRequest::Redirect() is called for handling a redirect, if

the new DISABLE_SHARED_DICTIONARY_AFTER_CROSS_ORIGIN_REDIRECT flag is

set, and the new url is different origin from the original URL, it

disables the LOAD_CAN_USE_SHARED_DICTIONARY flag. This is intended not

to use shared dictionary after redirected to cross origin URL.



This CL also adds a CHECK() in

network::CorsURLLoader::OnReceiveResponse() to ensure that opaque

response tainting requests did not use shared dictionary.



This CL also changes IsTrustedNavigationRequestFromSecureContext() to

use IsUrlPotentiallyTrustworthy() to support localhost URLs which are

potentially trustworthy. With this CL, we must pass a

shared_dictionary_storage to network::CorsURLLoader correctly to set

LOAD_CAN_USE_SHARED_DICTIONARY.



Bug: 1413922

Change-Id: I9139d8b16b1a97de240f0d9683ad1dfc551b9982

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4680574

entry.title: Introduce did_use_shared_dictionary flags and UseCounters
entry.content:
This CL introduces did_use_shared_dictionary flags in the following

structures:

- net::HttpResponseInfo

- network::mojom::URLResponseHead

- blink::WebURLResponse

- blink::ResourceResponse



Also this CL introduces the following UseCounters:

- SharedDictionaryUsed

- SharedDictionaryUsedForNavigation

- SharedDictionaryUsedForMainFrameNavigation

- SharedDictionaryUsedForSubFrameNavigation

- SharedDictionaryUsedForSubresource



To set this flag in HttpResponseInfo, this CL changes the

SharedDictionaryNetworkTransaction class to create a new

HttpResponseInfo with the flag set when it will use a shared dictionary.

And GetResponseInfo() will return the new HttpResponseInfo.



network::URLLoader::BuildResponseHead() sets the flag of

network::mojom::URLResponseHead. And blink::WebURLResponse::Create()

sets the flag of blink::ResourceResponse through blink::WebURLResponse.



When this flag was set, DocumentLoader::RecordUseCountersForCommit()

records the UseCounters for navigations, and

ResourceLoader::DidReceiveResponseInternal() records the UseCounters

for subresources.



Bug: 1413922

Change-Id: Icef7d1fb9db95783caae91ae0abb656e7bc3ed0f

entry.title: [IP Protection] Rename ::IpProtectionAuthTokenGetter
entry.content:
Renames ::IpProtectionAuthTokenGetter to

IpProtectionAuthTokenProvider to better distinguish it from

network::mojom::IpProtectionAuthTokenGetter. The former lives

in the browser process and provides tokens to the NetworkService,

whereas the latter is the mojom interface that the NetworkService

uses to request tokens.



This CL doesn't introduce any change in functionality, only

renaming.

entry.title: WebAppService Crosapi: Expose MigrateLauncherState()
entry.content:
This CL:

- Renames TransferAppAttributes() to MigrateLauncherState().

The old name was a copy paste of the implementation detail

of calling into AppListSyncableService::TransferItemAttributes().

- Removes MigrateLauncherState() from non-ChromeOS platforms.

- Exposes it over WebAppService crosapi to allow web apps

in Lacros to invoke the functionality inside the Ash process.



Forked from: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4311502



Bug: 1335299

entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning] Remove tick from folders when bulk pinning enabled
entry.content:
The available offline tick conveys to the user that all the items in the

folder should be available offline. When bulk pinning is on we kind of

guess that it will given we're enumerating and pinning all the items.

However, given we can never know if a hosted doc will eventually get

cached, this promise kind of breaks down.



For MVP, let's remove the tick for folders whilst the underlying work

gets broken down.



Fixed: b:290140363

Change-Id: Ia1b0ececb4977d7f70a0793e609c4a3307349816

entry.title: App Service: Add comment about replacement to AppPublisher::LoadIcon
entry.content:
In most cases, App Service running on Ash will not call LoadIcon, and

will instead call GetCompressedIconData. This adds a comment clarifying

this to the documentation for LoadIcon.



Note that LoadIcon _is_ still used on non-Ash platforms, which means

we're maintaining two separate icon pipelines, so we still need to

revisit this and figure out how to actually remove or simplify LoadIcon.



Bug: 1380608

entry.title: Add parameter to exclude PartitionAllocSupport from PartialLowEndMode.
entry.content:
Looking at the blink_perf.parser regression, it seems to be caused

by changing ThreadCache limits. PartitionAllocSupport changes the

limits by using ThreadCacheRegistry::SetThreadCacheMultiplier()

when PartialLowEndMode (and also LowEndMode) is enabled.



So add a parameter to PartialLowEndMode feature to exclude

PartitionAllocSupport when a process is not renderer and the param is

enabled, because the benchmark checks mainly renderer performance.

We will add a new group to the study and will see how the exclusion

affect performance and memory.



c.f. blink_perf.parser results comparing between disabled and

enabled with excluding PartitionAllocSupport are:

https://pinpoint-dot-chromeperf.appspot.com/job/1764fa53e60000

https://pinpoint-dot-chromeperf.appspot.com/job/12858f53e60000

entry.title: [css-flex] Test for gmail table regression
entry.content:
To fix a different flex regression, we made fixed layout tables not

return 10,000px for their intrinsic widths when they have a specified

percentage width:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4420422



But that broke this case, where the table's 10,000px was giving the

flexbox a large max-content size. That large max-content size flexbox

was then put into a fit-content table so shrunk to the available space.



When we made the max-content size be small instead of 10,000px, the

flexbox no longer took up the entire available space, breaking the page

layout.

entry.title: Fix race condition in PassthroughProgramCache.
entry.content:
PassthroughProgramCache has code to deal with multiple threads,

but BlobCacheGet() does not hold the lock for the entire time

it is called. This means it's possible for BlobCacheGet() to

attempt to use a cache value that was deleted by another thread.

BlobCacheGet() needs to hold the lock for the entirety of the

function.



Add a new PassthroughProgramCache::GetSize() method to handle the

locking since BlobCacheGet() is a static method which can not hold lock.

entry.title: gd: Implement Game Controls button functions
entry.content:
This CL adds logic for Game Controls buttons.

- If Game Controls is disabled by the feature tile button, the details

row will be disabled and the hint switch is disabled and switched off

if there is.

- If Game Controls is enabled, the details row will be enabled and the

hint hint switch is enabled. The hint switch state depends on the

flag.

- Once the "Set up" button or details row button is pressed, it enters

into Game Controls edit mode and closes the menu.

- If the Game Controls tile on the main menu is toggled on/off, the

quick toolbar should get updated to the main menu.

- The main menu doesn't need to update if the quick toolbar button is

toggled on/off, because the main menu is expected to close when

the input is outside of the main menu.

entry.title: Reland "Update notification state when blocker is added"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 93a845736c3c61c61a511dadbcdb6c8042406e0c



The issue with the original CL was that a newly-added death test would

check for a particular log message regardless of the build type. Log

messages for `CHECK()` statements are stripped for release builds, hence

that test would fail for those builds. This CL fixes the issue by using

`CHECK_WILL_STREAM()` to determine how strict the log message checking

should be. View the diff between patchset 1 and the latest patchset to

isolate this fix.



Original change's description:

> Update notification state when blocker is added

>

> Treat the addition of a new `NotificationBlocker` as a state-change

> event, as if `NotificationBlocker::Observer::OnBlockingStateChanged()`

> were called. Create a new `NotificationBlocker::Init()` method that must

> be called after a `NotificationBlocker`'s ctor to avoid calling a

> virtual function during construction. Update existing usages to the new

> initialization pattern.

>

> Fixed: b:286590651

entry.title: Fix same-version overinstalls on Mac.
entry.content:
OverinstallBroken exercises this codepath. It fails without this patch, which is intended to fix the issues revealed by this test:



* CopyDir fails if the bundle already exists. Removing the version directory first avoids this (and cleans up any other unexpected state in the destination).

* Failed update service proxy objects did not totally reset state on failure -- it could think it was still trying to connect after the connection attempt failed. Tracking connection-ness state separately from bound-ness of the mojo::Remote is unnecessary; removing tracking the "connecting" state gets rid of the unintended state reached here.

* After trying to change which update service exists and is active, it's a bit weird to expect the (previously failed) UpdateServiceProxy to keep working as intended. It does, but it feels conceptually weird. After a WakeCandidate, rebuild update_service_ to clean this up.



Also cleans up an IWYU violation on scoped_refptr.h

entry.title: Update host window bounds when scale factor has changed
entry.content:
With crrev.com/c/4630949 and crrev.com/c/4639542, the content size

of a root surface is used to check if the host window bounds

should be updated or not.



However, when there's a maximized window and scale factor changes,

only DP size changes while PX size stays the same. In this case,

host_window_->SetBounds() isn't called, and leads to a size

mismatch between the widget and host window.



Bug: b/290862328

entry.title: Fix gn build dependency encapsulation for //skia and //net
entry.content:
Deep in the dependency tree, //skia and //net/third_party/quiche define

build configs which are necessary for compiling headers from those

libraries. These are exported through public_configs. This means that

any file which transitively #includes anything from these directories

must have a dependency on //net and/or //skia, whether directly through

deps, or indirectly through public_deps, in order for the file to

compile.



This breaks encapsulation further up the dependency tree. For example,

//c/b/apps/app_service indirectly #includes files from these targets,

but does not export them as public_deps. Targets depending on

app_service won't compile unless they happen to have some other dep on

//net and //skia. The dependency is deeply nested and so there's no

obvious reason why this dep would be needed. Since most targets in Chromium are very large, this isn't normally a noticeable problem,

but it has caused problems in //c/b/chromeos/office_web_app.



gn has an option for this, `all_dependent_configs`, which applies the

config to everything which transitively depends on the target. This CL

applies that option to the existing configs defined for //skia and

//net/third_party/quiche.



Bug: None

Change-Id: Ia33822cd12d957a1dafcd1a9f67c08fd7965cbfc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4665362

Reviewed-by: Brian Osman

entry.title: iwa: Migrate Storage Partitions GC from Extensions to Web Apps system
entry.content:
Both Chrome Apps and Isolated Web Apps use isolated Storage Partitions.

This means any Storage Partition garbage collection system using

BrowserContext::GarbageCollectStoragePartitions() must be aware of valid

Storage Partition paths from both systems.



Chrome Apps are being deprecated and IWAs need to work with web app

command system to avoid race conditions. We are migrating Storage

Partition garbage collection system from ExtensionsGarbageCollector to

web_app::GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand. The new GC system will

support Chrome Apps until they are fully removed.



This CL does a few things to fully delete

ExtensionGarbageCollector::GarbageCollectIsolatedStorageIfNeeded and

replace it with GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand.



For Extensions code:

- Replace ExtensionsPref::kStorageGarbageCollect with

pref::kShouldGarbageCollectStoragePartitions

- Remove

ExtensionGarbageCollector::GarbageCollectIsolatedStorageIfNeeded and

its associated InstallGate.



For Web Apps code:

- Register pref::kShouldGarbageCollectStoragePartitions.

- Sets prefs::kShouldGarbageCollectStoragePartitions to true in

remove_web_app_job.cc

- Register and unregister extensions::InstallGate in

GarbageCollectStoragePartitionsCommand via ExtensionsManager.

- Invokes GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand in PostProfileInit if

pref is true.

- Implicitly call GarbageCollectStoragePartitionCommand from restart

using PRE test in

garbage_collect_storage_partitions_command_browsertest.cc



Low-Coverage-Reason:



Change-Id: I5d418dc1b1f7bfc5890850d94d11a827b794b2ff

Bug: 1453520

view



Clicking the start casting button on the quick settings media view

should redirect the user to the quick settings media detailed view and

entry.title: Add a new scale factor request to remote_shell_v2
entry.content:
Partly analogous to Lacros change: crrev.com/c/4034899.



This CL adds a new Wayland protocol to remote_shell_v2 to give

clients control to synchronize buffers and scale factors.



The new protocol exactly matches the counterpart in

aura_toplevel so we can share the implementation as much as

possible and prevent potential rounding errors.



The actual change in ClientControlledShellSurface will be made

once all clients of remote_shell_v2 supports this protocol as

there's no way for ClientControlledShellSurface to know if it's

supported or not (b/c ShellSurfaceHost::GetScaleFactor just

returns float instead of optional).



Bug: b/290565343

entry.title: Revert "Fix race condition and re-enable tests."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 9a19121ba164716769ebb468350fa57ef28b44cc.



Reason for revert: Using WebContentsObserver brought back an old crash bug, which I now recall is why we were using the render widget host. This CL needs to be reverted.



See the failure here:

https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/build-8775645265322080401/test-results?q=HelpBubbleFactoryWebUIInteractiveUiTest.FloatingHelpBubbleHiddenOnWebUiHidden&sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> Fix race condition and re-enable tests.

>

> Failures were caused by a race condition in HelpBubbleHandler that could affect Aura platforms. This update fixes the race condition, which caused the affected tests to flake, by switching to observing WebContents visibility rather than RenderWidgetHost.

entry.title: [Nearby][Self Share] Advertise when in YourDevices visibility
entry.content:
Enable YourDevices visibility certificates to be created and uploaded

to the Nearby server.



Note that, at the moment, when creating a public certificate for

upload, setting the `for_self_share` field doesn't allow for a

functional 'Your Devices' visibility (b/291132662).

To circumvent this problem, when in Your Devices visibility,

in this CL, the public certificate is set to 'Selected Contacts',

which is effectively 'Your Devices' visibility because the allowed

contacts list is empty besides the user's own account.

This hack should be fixed in the future but is working for now.



Tested: no issues when deployed to DUT



Fixed: b/279939804

entry.title: [Tab Previews] Only capture preview on actual tab switch.
entry.content:
Tab Previews wants to capture any tab that is being switched away from;

this saves any visual updates (such as scrolling) that happened while

the tab was visible to the user.



However, previously, this was done by watching the WebContents for

visibility changes, which also caught a number of potentially unwanted

or even unsafe situations, such as:

- A closing tab

- A tab in a browser window being closed

- A tab being moved between browser windows (but still active)



This CL does two things:

- Changes this capture to happen only on active tab switch.

- Checks RenderWidgetHostView::IsSurfaceAvailableForCopy(), which may

further avoid issues on e.g. Mac (and is generally considered best

practice).



It also cleans up some small code issues.



Bug: 1374153

Change-Id: I8f0db29acaac9c9c2fec77df8d6bc39186e8a5fb

entry.title: Hook up webview to gpu OnVisibilityChanged
entry.content:
A webview is visible if it's attached a window and window is visible.

Note this is simpler than "client visibility" which defaults to true

even when starting as detached. And gpu is background if all webviews

are not visible.



Need some complexity between BrowserViewRenderer and

SynchronousCompositor since a single BVR can talk to be multiple

SynchronousCompositors. Only mark the active one visible, but ensure

to always keep at least one SynchronousCompositor visible during

transition.



Then net effect is will immediately call

GpuChannelManager::OnApplicationBackgrounded on background.

On low end devices, will also run

GpuChannelManager::OnBackgroundCleanup with a delay, which (tries to)

cleans up the GPU thread context and drops GPU channels.



Bug: 1442988

Change-Id: I76ee3592b2dd0e077bde72c4669e5a9834259697

entry.title: [Inspector] Skip adding source data for non-existent implicit nested groups
entry.content:
See the bug for the reproduction and issue description.



The crux of the issue lies in nested group rules[1] and how the parser notifies the observer when they encounter such rules.



Take the CSS below as example:

```

.foo {

@supports(display: flex) {

& {

color: red;

}

}

}

```



While parsing the body of the `@supports` rule above, CSS parser notifies the observer that this might be the start of the implicit nested group with a zero length header range[2].



However, if there are no properties for this implicit nested group, CSS parser doesn't register it so such a group doesn't exist for the rule list got from the parser[3].



in this CL, to match the same behavior with the CSS parser while registering the source data, we check whether there are any properties parsed for this possible "implicit nested group".



If not, we skip adding the rule itself and only take its child rules' data.



[1]: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-nesting-1/#nested-group-rules

[2]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/parser/css_parser_impl.cc;l=2122;drc=255b4e7036f1326f2219bd547d3d6dcf76064870

[3]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/parser/css_parser_impl.cc;l=2131;drc=255b4e7036f1326f2219bd547d3d6dcf76064870



Fixed: 1445720

Change-Id: Ifbd2e85873374929d0ceadf4fb5905eaf4ddd62b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4681759

Reviewed-by: Changhao Han

Commit-Queue: Changhao Han

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1170208}

entry.title: Consolidate classroom course work related structs
entry.content:
Removes GlanceablesClassroomStudentSubmission, which is used only to

cache student submissions when requesting classroom data, and then to

calculate the course work "submission" status. The submission state is

now add directly to GlanceablesClassroomCourseWorkItem, and is updated

dynamically in response to fetching student submissions. When fetching

course work and student submissions data, GlanceablesClassroomClientImpl

will keep the fetched data in the `course_work_` map, and update it as

responses come in. Note that GlanceablesClassroomCourseWorkItem

intentionally has only default constructor, to support the case where

student submissions for a course work item are fetched before the actual

course work item (which could be the case when fetching assignments for

students). Also, moves GlanceablesClassroomCourseWorkItem class to

chrome/, as it's not used in ash/, and so it can take dependencies on

raw classroom google api types.



BUG=b:283371186

entry.title: Use UI message loop type for Linux Print Backend service
entry.content:
Printing a document on Linux makes calls through the

PrintDialogLinuxInterface. Calls made through this interface can

appear to succeed but actually fail to run if there is not a running

message pump to process the commands issued. This causes a false

positive for printing status, with no errors reported but also no print

job actually printing.



Update the invocation of Linux to use a UI message loop type. Also

change the thread runner used on Linux to work with the default runner.

This ensures that the printing commands actually run.



Fixed: 1464683

Change-Id: I69d27739bef732bd52e12473d6ea7ff7deef039a

entry.title: Update compositing on scroll if a synthethized clip depends on scroll
entry.content:
A synthesized clip layer that masks a layer with backdrop effect bakes

the difference between the clip's transform space and the masked

layer's transform space in the layer geometry and paint operations.

If the transform spaces cross any scroll translation, we can't omit

PAC update on any scroll of the scroller.



Bug: 1459318

entry.title: [PhoneHub][Nudge]Update nudge and notification display logic and add
entry.content:
experiment control logic.



For the Phone Hub nudge experiment, the multi-device notification and

phone hub icon/nudge should be shown:

a) immediately post OOBE setup if eligibility is available;

b) within 5 minutes of user session if eligibility is available or;

c) at the next login if eligibility is found after 5 minutes into user

session.



Bug: b/282990933

Tested: Manually tested and verified following cases on DUT:

1). When feature flag disabled: notification behaviors stay unchanged.

2). When in nudge experiment group: a). PH icon and nudge appear after

OOBE completed; b) PH icon and nudge appear if user becomes

eligible for PH within 5 minutes of session start; c), PH icon and

nudge do not appear until next login/unlock if user becomes

eligible after 5 minutes of session start.

3). When in notification experiment group, notification and PH icon

behave the same as in 2).

entry.title: [QuickStart] Return More Granular Errors from QuickStartMessage::Read
entry.content:
This change makes `QuickStartMessage::Read` return a more granular error

on parsing. This is important, since for the FIDO flow, we want to skip

over messages which aren't FIDO messages. This change allows us to

distinguish between different messages entirely (different Payload

keys), and messages which failed serialization for other reasons.

entry.title: Fix folder upload triggering two detection requests.
entry.content:
1. Merge the logic of `FolderUploadContentAnalysisCompletionCallback` into `ContentAnalysisCompletionCallback`.

2. Update the relevant test cases, delete the `FolderUploadBlockedThenAllowed` one since it is no longer applicable.

3. Replace some `FULL_SAFE_BROWSING` build flag with `ENTERPRISE_CLOUD_CONTENT_ANALYSIS` to better reflect when the code should be run.

4. Include `net/cert/x509_certificate.h` in `chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_window.cc` because previously it was implicitly included via `chrome/browser/file_select_helper.h`

5. Manual testing screencast (https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjAxNTQ4MTUzMTA3MjUxMnxlMTgwOTRkYy01OQ)

* Upload a folder with sensitive file would trigger only 1 detection request, the entire folder is blocked

* Upload a folder with non-sensitive file only would go through



Bug: b/289134529

entry.title: [FedCM] Keep bottomsheet alive when a tab is hidden
entry.content:
This CL allows the AccountSelectionMediator to keep track of the state

so that the sheet is not dismissed when the user hides a tab. This means

that there may be multiple pending bottomsheets at a given time, so the

BottomSheetObserver needs to only care about changes when the latest

bottomsheet is the one owned by the object, so onSheetContentChanged()

is used for this purpose. A TabObserver is used to ensure that the

bottomsheet is only shown when the tab is interactable.



Bug: 1456368

entry.title: Don't remove focus from page elements during content scanning.
entry.content:
If focus is removed, then when the user pastes into an edit field, then

after the paste is done, they will need to click the field again to

continue typing. Instead of clearing focus when a content analysis

dialog is showed, save it. Then restore the focus when the dialog

is destroyed.
